keyword: calories in a gin and tonic water
title: Calories in a Gin and Tonic
meta_description: Discover calories in a gin and tonic water, including carbs, sugars, and full nutrition breakdown for one standard serving.
h1: Calories in a Gin and Tonic
assumptions: Standard serving: 1.5 oz (44 ml) gin + 4 oz (118 ml) tonic water; no ice, lime, or added sugar.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, pour size, tonic type, and mix ratios. Alcoholic content affects calorie absorption; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One gin and tonic has about 150 kcal, mostly from alcohol and tonic sugars.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a gin and tonic water?
faqs.a: About 150 kcal for a standard 1.5 oz gin + 4 oz tonic serving.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in gin and tonic?
faqs.a: Yes, around 10.5 g carbs per serving, all from tonic sugars.

faqs.q: What's the calorie difference with diet tonic?
faqs.a: Diet tonic reduces it to ~110 kcal by eliminating sugars.
Yes, 1.5 oz gin has ~97 kcal from alcohol, with 0 carbs or sugars.

faqs.q: How does tonic water affect the calories?
faqs.a: Regular tonic adds ~53 kcal and 10.5 g sugars per 4 oz; opt for diet to cut this.
